title: Greek Lemon Chicken & Potatoes
description: Roasted chicken and potatoes tossed in a bright lemon-oregano marinade and baked until crisp on the outside and juicy inside. Simple Mediterranean flavors—lemon, garlic, oregano, and olive oil—infuse the meat and vegetables for an easy one-pan dinner.

ingredients.notes: about 200 g per thigh; can use a mix of thighs and drumsticks

ingredients.display_name: yellow potatoes, medium, scrubbed and quartered

ingredients.notes: used to keep potatoes moist during roasting
adds richness; can omit for dairy-free

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a large rimmed baking sheet or roasting pan with foil or parchment for easier cleanup.
Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Season both sides of the chicken thighs with half of the salt and pepper.
In a large bowl combine olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, minced garlic, dried oregano, chopped rosemary (if using), melted butter, remaining salt and pepper. Whisk to emulsify the marinade.
Toss the quartered potatoes and onion wedges in roughly half of the marinade until evenly coated. Spread potatoes in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet, leaving space for the chicken.

Place the seasoned chicken thighs skin-side up on the baking sheet among the potatoes. Brush or drizzle the remaining marinade over the chicken. Pour the chicken stock evenly around the pan (not over skin) to keep the potatoes moist.
Roast in the preheated oven for 35 minutes, uncovered, until the potatoes begin to brown and the chicken skin is crisping. Halfway through, use tongs to turn some potato pieces for even browning.

Increase oven temperature to 220°C (425°F) and roast for an additional 10-12 minutes until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 75°C (165°F) and skin is deeply golden; potatoes should be fork-tender and caramelized in spots.
Remove the pan from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Spoon pan juices over the chicken and potatoes, sprinkle with chopped parsley, and adjust seasoning if needed before serving.
